title: Bramall Hall
summary: Bramall Hall is a largely Tudor manor house in Bramhall, within the Metropolitan Borough of Stockport, Greater Manchester, England. It is a timber-framed building; the oldest parts of which date from the 14th century, with later additions from the 16th and 19th centuries.  The house, which functions as a museum, and its 70 acres (28Â ha) of landscaped parkland with lakes, woodland and gardens (Bramhall Park) are open to the public.
